sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Basil of Caesarea, Admonitio ad filium spiritualem. Isidore of Seville, Etymologiae (extract). Chronicles
Basilius. Bestiary. Chronica
msDesc.p: Vellum, 154 112 , 6 x 4.3, ff. 4 + 191, 28 lines to a page. Cent. xiii late, well written. Curious clumsy initials in colour.

On f. ir (faint), a xvth cent. list of contents.
On ff. iv-ivr are notes in a good hand of cent. xiii-xiv. On ff. iiv-iiir Extracts from the Testaments of Dan, Joseph, Aser, Zabulon.
On f. iiiv: Dixit autem Ieremias hec dicit dominus. Ego iuraui in nomine meo magno quod omnes uiri iuda qui sunt in terra egipti gladio et fame peribunt. donec penitus consumantur. Et insurrexit populus aduersus Jeremiam et lapidauerunt eum. Hic est ieremias qui regibus egipti signum dedit quod eorum idola euerti oporteret cum uirgo pareret. Legitur enim quod saluator noster in egiptum descendit cum herodes querebat animam illius. Quo intrante omnia idola egipti collisa corruerunt in terram. Dixit itaque presentibus. Dominus ex syon recessit ad celos inde rursus in uirtute uenturus. Erit signum presencie eius quando uniuerse gentes adorauerint lignum.
Extracts from Testaments of Simeon, Levi, Juda.
On f. ivv in a pretty hand:
Semen feniculi xi habet uirtutes.
Fugat demones
...
Deponit uentositatem.
Lower down is an erasure. Another at top of f. 1r.

msItem.head: pseudo-Basil of Caesarea, Admonitio ad filium spiritualem

head.title: Liber sancti Basilii episcopi Capadociae ad filios spirituales de militia spirituali

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Sancti Basilii episcopi Capadocie ad filios spiritales de milicia spirituali
msItem.incipit: Attende tibi fili ut possis dissernere ab utilibus noxia. Nam duplex est uita nostra
msItem.explicit: et remedii et emendacionis cura pensetur

msItem.head: Isidore of Seville, Etymologiae (excerpt from book 12, chapters 4-7)

head.title: Tractatus de omnibus animantibus et eorum proprietatibus

msItem.incipit: Omnibus animantibus adam primum uocabula indidit
msItem.ab: Last section on Perdix, followed by paragraph on eggs
msItem.explicit: oua quoque admixta calce glutinare fertur uitri fragmenta

head.title: Proverbia et alia verba edificatoria in ordine disposita

msItem.rubric: Incipiunt prouerbia et alia uerba edificatoria in ordine disposita
msItem.incipit: Anima est substancia creata inuisibilis incorporea inmortalis deo similima
msItem.ab: followed by De amicicia, audacia, etc. in alphabetical order
The last De xpo and De Antixpo ending
msItem.explicit: Post hec qua die iudicium fiat omnis ignorat

head.title: A short tract on the Emperors

msItem.incipit: Est autem tirannus ut cum (eum) philosophi depincxerunt. Qui uiolenta dominacione premit populum
msItem.rubric: De morte sesaris et aliorum principum et tyrannorum
msItem.ab: The Twelve Caesars. Nerva, Trajan, Sennacherib, Philip, Decius, Aurelian, Carus, Constantine, Julian, Valens, Theodosius, Karolus
msItem.explicit: Cogitetur igitur quomodo predicti imperatores siue boni siue mali exinaniti sunt et ad nichilum deuenerunt
ut uix quisquam principum eorum ad exitum uite natura ducente peruenerit

head.title: Brevis chronica a Bruto ad Egbertum
Chronicle of Britain (mostly from Geoffrey of Monmouth)

msItem.incipit: Eneas uero Romani generis auctor genuit Ascanium. Ascanius genuit siluium
msItem.explicit: Post mortem Brithici regis Regnauit Adelbrich super Wessexe. quem Beda uocat Ecgbrit. Anno gratie dccco octauo

head.title: Chronicle of English kings from Egbert to Edgar
Chronique des rois d'Angleterre d'Egbert a Edgar

msItem.incipit: Iadis altens as engles soleyt engletere estre departi a. v. parties ea .v. reis
msItem.ab: After a short prologue resumes with Egbert and ends unfinished with a story of Edgar
msItem.explicit: Si mist lum le cors en fertre. Iluc an eires recut un forgene sun sens. et un orb la uue
msItem.ab: ff. 184r-191v have notes and extracts in various hands
msItem.incipit: Lex dei et premium habet et penam legentibus eam
msItem.ab: On f. 187v in a later hand
Part of the poem Vado mori is on f. 188v
On the following pages (ff. 189r-191v) the notes are in the hand of those at the beginning of the volume. They are largely from Augustine: two also from Josephus
